frame.name: Conquering
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame describes a <fen>Theme</fen> losing its autonomy and perhaps sustaining material damage as the result of a successful invasion on the behalf of a <fen>Conqueror</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Conqueror">The Spaniards</fex> <t>conquered</t> <fex name="Theme">the Incas</fex> <fex name="Instrument">with both the Cross and the arquebus</fex></ex>
<ex>He said that the aim had been the <t>takeover</t> <fex name="Theme">of the Soviet government</fex> <fex name="Conqueror">by "advocates of swift privatization"</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Theme">The Romans</fex> <t>fell</t> <fex name="Conqueror">to the Goths</fex> <fex name="Time">in 410 AD</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Conqueror">Bright Star campaign forces</fex> <t>captured</t> <fex name="Theme">the garrison town of Kajo Kaji</fex></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Conqueror
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Conqueror</fen> is the entity that overtakes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Conqueror">The Achaemenid monarch Cambyses</fex> <t>conquered</t> Egypt in the year 525 BC</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the land, government, and its people that is seized by the <fen>Conqueror</fen>.
<ex>Britain had an opportunity to <t>conquer</t> <fex name="Theme">Europe</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE describes the intensity and extent of the conquering event.
<ex>Britain had been ` <fex name="Degree">completely</fex> <t>conquered</t> and immediately thrown away '</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>The manner in which the <fen>Conqueror</fen> takes over the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>He <fex name="Manner">violently</fex> <t>captured</t> the castles of La Haye , Preuilly and Champigny</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action by which the conquering event is made possible through the efforts of the <fen>Conqueror</fen>.
<ex>They <t>captured</t> the haunted castle <fex name="Means">by bombarding it with low-energy x-rays</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Conqueror</fen> takes over the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Place">On Planet Earth</fex>, humans prefer to <t>conquer</t> those lands whose acquistion offers some economic benefit or advantage.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Conqueror</fen> seizes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>China 's <fex name="Time">1997</fex> <t>takeover</t> would push over 10 per cent of the population out of the colony</ex>.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The reason why the <fen>Conqueror</fen> seized the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>Rome initially <t>conquered</t> lands <fex name="Purpose">in order to enrich itself</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>The tool used by the <fen>Conqueror</fen> to seize the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>The army will <t>conquer</t> the far-away lands <fex name="Instrument">with the most sophisticated weapons ever made</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. </def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Frequency</fen> is the number of times the Conquering event occurs per some unit of time.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: conquer.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: seize a land and its government by force

lexUnit.name: takeover.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: The seizing of a land, its people, and its goverment by force.

lexUnit.name: capture.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: forcibly taking over a land, its people, and its governement.

lexUnit.name: fall.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be taken over and potentially destroyed by an army

lexUnit.name: take.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to occupy and have authority over a locale and its people.
